intro: Oxytropis nivalis, commonly known as the snow lotus, is a flowering plant native to the high alpine regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that bloom in late spring or early summer. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils at elevations above 2,000 meters. Its leaves are usually trifoliate, and the plant is adapted to cold climates with a short growing season. Oxytropis nivalis is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
